title: Leicester City preparing huge new contract for Ben Chilwell amid Chelsea interest
text:
Leicester City left-back Ben Chilwell is on Chelsea’s transfer radar (Picture: Getty)

Leicester City are looking to make Ben Chilwell one of their highest-paid players by offering him a new £100,000 per week deal in an attempt to ward off interest from Chelsea.

The 22-year-old has emerged as one of the best left-backs in the Premier League over the past couple of seasons and started for England in their 6-0 win over Bulgaria on Monday night.

Given his outstanding form, Chilwell has been earmarked as one of Frank Lampard’s top targets once Chelsea are able to buy players again following their UEFA transfer ban.

Reports last week claimed that Chelsea are leading the chase to sign Chilwell ahead of Manchester United and are hopeful of launching a bid for him in January if their appeal against a two-window ban is successful.

Chilwell impressed during England’s 6-0 win over Bulgaria on Monday night (Picture: Getty)

Lampard has gained plaudits for constructing a new-look Chelsea side around promising young English talents such as Fikayo Tomori, Mason Mount, Callum Hudson-Odoi and Tammy Abraham and Chilwell would fit his philosophy.

It was also reported earlier this month that Leicester boss Brendan Rodgers had instructed the club’s scouting team to find him a new first-team left-back amid fears Chilwell could be sold for a big fee next summer.

However, the Foxes will not let Chilwell move on without a fight and are looking to tie him down to a new six-figure weekly salary, just under a year since he signed a six-year deal with the club, according to the Daily Star.

Leicester held firm in their valuation of Harry Maguire over the summer, eventually selling the centre-back to Manchester United for £80m and they are believed to value Chilwell at around £50m following his strong start to the season.

Emerson Palmieri started the season as Lampard’s first-choice left-back but has been sidelined with a thigh problem since September paving the way for Marcos Alonso to be given an extended run in the side.
